definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle

sentences.english: His wool shirt always itches him.
sentences.chinese: 他的羊毛内衣总是使他发痒。

sentences.english: Long grass tickled their legs like creepy crawlies.
sentences.chinese: 长长的草像蠕动的爬虫使他们腿发痒。

sentences.english: At very high intensities, nuclear radiations cause itching and tingling of the skin.
sentences.chinese: 当核辐射强度很高时，它能使皮肤感到发痒和刺痛。

sentences.english: This syrup is especially good for dry or tickly coughs.
sentences.chinese: 这种糖浆特别适合干咳或喉咙发痒引起的咳嗽。

sentences.english: Pepper tickles if it gets into the nose.
sentences.chinese: 胡椒进入鼻孔会使人发痒。

sentences.english: This might tickle, but it feels divine.
sentences.chinese: 这可能会使她发痒，但感觉很奇妙。

sentences.english: She didn't get better, and her palms started itching.
sentences.chinese: 她没有好转并且她的手掌开始发痒。

sentences.english: It was very hot and when i woke my legs itched .
sentences.chinese: 那天很热，我一醒来，腿上发痒。

sentences.english: Sometimes wearing hats and helmets too tightly can cause itchiness. Will that also lead to hair loss?
sentences.chinese: 帽子或头盔戴得过紧会头皮发痒，并造成脱发？

sentences.english: Aveeno Soothing Baby Bath Treatment For soothing relief of dry, itchy, irritated skin. aveeno.
sentences.chinese: 安抚婴儿浴治疗安抚救济干，发痒，刺激皮肤。

sentences.english: The beautiful fragrance tickled my nose and I smiled again.
sentences.chinese: 美妙的芬芳令我的鼻子发痒，我又笑了笑。

sentences.english: Walking down the street, one was left with a tickle in the throat and burning eyes.
sentences.chinese: 走在大街上，直让人觉得喉咙发痒眼睛刺疼。
穿这件新衬衫让人身上发痒。

sentences.english: Sometimes the sc alp is red or itchy and feels tense. Thair has a dull appearance.
sentences.chinese: 有时头皮呈红色，发痒或发紧，头发暗无生气。

sentences.english: It can be the token, and fever, blain blain and itch.
sentences.chinese: 这病可不好惹，又发烧，身上的痘痘又发痒。

sentences.english: My nose tickles and I sneeze.

definition: variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle
to scratch/to mess about with/to quarrel/to scramble to do/sb or sth that one can rely on
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
(of dry soil, skin etc) to crack/to chap
